description: information about works of classical literature

command.prompt:
Generate 2 rows for a table of information about works of classical literature. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes for the table is:
Characters;Author;Title;Year;Rating;Style;Genre;Poem;Element;Length;Original Language;Number of Pages;Theme

Do not generate fictional rows. Generate the rows from real known data. Here is a list of semi-colon-separated rows not to generate by semantic key only:
Author;Title
Austen;Pride and Prejudice
Dickens;Great Expectations
Garcia-Marquez;One Hundred Years of Solitude
Hardy;Tess of the d'Urbervilles
Herrick;To the Virgins
Homer;The Iliad
Joyce;Ulysses
Plath;Ariel
Shakespeare;As You Like It
Shelley;Ozymandias
Vonnegut;Slaughterhouse-Five

Output the rows in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file with a column header. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Characters;Author;Title;Year;Rating;Style;Genre;Poem;Element;Length;Original Language;Number of Pages;Theme
Hamlet, Claudius, Gertrude;Shakespeare;Hamlet;1603;5/5;Tragedy;Drama;No;Dramatic;Long;English;432;Betrayal, Revenge
Odysseus, Athena, Poseidon;Homer;The Odyssey;800 BC;5/5;Epic;Poetry;Yes;Mythological;Long;Greek;237;Journey, Return
command.epilogue:
The data for the first row is sourced from the play "Hamlet" by William Shakespeare, first published in 1603. The main characters listed are Hamlet, Claudius, and Gertrude. The rating is subjective and given as 5/5. The style is tragic and the genre is drama. It is not a poem and its main element is dramatic. The length is long, it is written in English, and the number of pages is 432 in the specific edition used as reference. The theme of the play revolves around betrayal and revenge.

The data for the second row is sourced from the epic poem "The Odyssey" by Homer, dated around 800 BC. The main characters listed are Odysseus, Athena, and Poseidon. The rating is subjective and given as 5/5. The style is epic and the genre is poetry. It is a poem and its main element is mythological. The length is long, it is written in Greek, and the number of pages is 237 in the specific edition used as reference. The theme of the epic revolves around the journey and return of Odysseus.
